Martin Charles Scorsese (born November 17, 1942) is an Italian-American film director, producer, screenwriter and actor. Scorsese has been credited as one of the best directors of all time, as well as being a major figure in the New Hollywood era. His films have won various awards including, an Academy Award, four BAFTA Awards, three Emmy Awards, a Grammy Award, three Golden Globe Awards, and two Directors Guild of America Awards. Scorsese is also well known for his collaborations with actors including, Robert De Niro and Leonardo DiCaprio, who have also both been credited as being one of the greatest actors of all time.

His films include, Who's That Knocking at My Door (1967), Boxcar Bertha (1972), Mean Streets (1973), Alice Doesn't Live Here Anymore (1974), Taxi Driver (1976), New York, New York (1977), Raging Bull (1980), The King of Comedy (1982), After Hours (1985), The Color of Money (1986), The Last Temptation of Christ (1988), Goodfellas (1990), Cape Fear (1991), The Age of Innocence (1993), Casino (1995), Kundun (1997), Bringing Out the Dead (1999), Gangs of New York (2002), The Aviator (2004), The Departed (2006), Shutter Island (2010), Hugo (2011), The Wolf of Wall Street (2013), The Irishman (2019) and Killers of the Flower Moon (2023). Out of all of his films, Mean Streets, Taxi Driver, Raging Bull and Goodfellas are often cited among the greatest films ever made.

Early life

Martin Charles Scorsese was born on November 17, 1942 in Queens, New York City. Before Scorsese started school, he and his parents, Charles and Catherine Scorsese, both of Italian descent, moved to Little Italy, Manhattan. Scorsese was raised in a Catholic environment. As a child, Martin suffered from asthma and was unable to partake in playing sports with other children. To make up for this, Martin's parents and his older brother, Frank would frequently bring Scorsese to the movie theaters, which gave Scorsese his love of film. Scorsese attended the all-boys Cardinal Hayes High School in the Bronx and graduated in 1960. At first, Martin wished to be a priest and instead attended NYU's Washington Square College.

Personal life

In 1965, Scorsese married Laraine Marie Brennan and had a daughter named Catherine, after his mother, but divorced in 1971. Five years later, he married writer, Julia Cameron and had a daughter, Domenica Cameron-Scorsese, however the marriage lasted only one year. Around this time, Scorsese also struggled with a serious cocaine addiction after the financial failure of his film, New York, New York, which nearly led him to his death, to which he then quit. Scorsese then married actress, Isabella Rossellini in 1979 but divorced her four years later. Afterwards, he married Barbara De Fina in 1985 and divorced her in 1991, with Scorsese also having a sexual relationship with Illeana Douglas that ended in 1997. Since 1999, Scorsese has been married to Helen Schermerhorn Morris, who he has a daughter with named Francesca. According to Scorsese, he is both a lapsed Catholic and a Roman Catholic.
